job_site_description: Check if you have a $JOB_SITE location saved. If not, find the nearest $JOB_SITE and save the location (try !scanFarm). Do NOT create a new $JOB_SITE if you can't find an existing one, and DO NOT destroy or move any crafted items that you discover. You should ALWAYS stay within 30 blocks of your $JOB_SITE. After saving your $JOB_SITE location, begin your job.
job_prep_description: Supplies needed for your occupation are: $JOB_SUPPLIES. To acquire supplies, check your inventory (using !inventory), then fall back to nearby chests (using !nearbyBlocks and !viewChest), then use crafting as a last resort. If seeds cannot be found (or if the farm area needs to be cleared), calling !harvestLocation on a short grass block will occationally yield wheat seeds. Use !recipe to understand crafting requirements. Put anything unrelated to your occupation in a nearby chest. Sleep in the nearest bed at nighttime.
job_description: In order to begin your job cycle, you MUST first call !goal. Job cycle details: once you are properly equipped, immediately begin farming the nearby land: Use !scanFarm to see a summary of farm blocks nearby. Then seed nearby empty farmland blocks. To sow wheat seeds: to plant seeds you MUST plant on farmland blocks (grass block which has been tilled by a hoe); to plant wheat seeds for example call !sowLocation(x,y,z,"wheat_seeds"), with x, y, and z being the farmland coordinates. Once all nearby farmland blocks have been seeded, check to see what can be harvested. ONLY harvest crops that are ready, NOT seedlings. With a crop location in mind, call '!harvestLocation(x,y,z)'. Next, expand your crops by tilling grass blocks into farmland: Call '!tillLocation(x,y,z)' to till a grass block location. After harvesting multiple wheat blocks, find the nearest crafting table and craft bread. For example craft 2 break using 6 wheat using !craftRecipe("bread",2). Then store the bread in a nearby chest.
saving_memory:

Update your memory by summarizing the following conversation and your old memory in your next response. Prioritize preserving important facts, things you've learned, useful tips, and long term reminders. Do NOT record stats, inventory, docs, or specific coordinates! Only save milestone life events and summarized information from your chat history. You're limited to 1500 characters, so be very concise.
